text: Walter Beaman Jones Jr. (February 10, 1943 - February 10, 2019) was an American politician. He was the U.S. Representative for from 1995 to 2019. He was a Republican. Jones's father was Walter B. Jones Sr., a Democratic Party congressman from the neighboring 1st district. Jones became well known for leading the effort to have french fries renamed "freedom fries" in House cafeteria menus as a protest against French opposition to the 2003 invasion of Iraq. In July 2018, Jones began to miss votes due his amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. In December 2018, he was given a leave of absence for the remainder of the session.Ailing Rep. Walter Jones in rehab for a broken hip, will miss more votes , by Emily Kopp, in Roll Call; published January 17, 2019; retrieved January 17, 2019 In January 2019, he broke his hip. On January 26, 2019, his wife said that he is under hospice care. Jones Jr. died on his 76th birthday in Greenville, North Carolina from complications of the broken hip and ALS. ==References== ==Other websites== * Congressman Walter Jones official U.S. House site * Walter Jones for Congress * * * Category:1943 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from fractured hip Category:Deaths from motor neurone disease Category:United States representatives from North Carolina Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
